4_1Ci5Y4TxZwY1SQhvQR7Ttbdyyai4WRV5TU.body: Well, Gentoo has the ability to be much more "pure" though requires a bit more manual intervention for things to run smoothly. Arch is only "good" because aside from the 15 - 30 minute install (if done manually and not scripted) it requires very little manual intervention. Both are comfy as fuck, it just depends on how much granular control you desire.

2_1Ci5Y4TxZwY1SQhvQR7Ttbdyyai4WRV5TU.body: I don't think there is, though you might want to take a peek at teknik.io if you're trying to move away from SJWHub (at least until a suitable alternative is written for ZeroNet)
